{"text": "Chloroquine was shown to inhibit quinone reductase 2 [ 56 ] , a structural neighbour of UDP-N-acetylglucosamine 2-epimerases [ 57 ] that are involved in the biosynthesis of sialic acids . The sialic acids are acidic monosaccharides found at the extremity of sugar chains present on cell transmembrane proteins and are critical components of ligand recognition . {"text": "Chloroquine was shown to inhibit quinone reductase 2 [ 56 ] , a structural neighbour of UDP-N-acetylglucosamine 2-epimerases [ 57 ] that are involved in the biosynthesis of sialic acids . The sialic acids are acidic monosaccharides found at the extremity of sugar chains present on cell transmembrane proteins and are critical components of ligand recognition . The possible interference of chloroquine with sialic acid biosynthesis could account for the broad antiviral spectrum of that drug since viruses such as the human coronavirus HCoV-O43 and the orthomyxoviruses use sialic acid moieties as receptors [ 58 ] .", "labels": [[209, 216, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [0, 12, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [554, 587, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [271, 301, "PROTEIN"], [512, 537, "PROTEIN"], [0, 12, "CHEMICAL"], [33, 53, "GGP"], [0, 12, "CHEBI"], [554, 575, "CHEBI"], [375, 391, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [554, 575, "CHEMICAL"], [391, 408, "CHEMICAL"], [245, 264, "PROTEIN"], [33, 53, "PROTEIN"], [554, 587, "PROTEIN"], [157, 180, "CHEMICAL"], [271, 287, "CELLULAR_COMPONENT"], [271, 301, "GO"], [157, 180, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [186, 199, "CHEMICAL"], [375, 391, "CHEMICAL"], [33, 53, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [245, 258, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [391, 408, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [186, 199, "CHEBI"], [186, 199, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [157, 180, "CHEBI"], [85, 112, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [238, 245, "PATHOLOGICAL_FORMATION"], [375, 391, "CHEBI"], [391, 408, "CHEBI"], [512, 525, "ORGANISM"], [199, 216, "CHEBI"], [519, 537, "CHEMICAL"], [33, 41, "CHEMICAL"], [546, 554, "TAXON"]]}

{"text": "Studies have also revealed some other drugs may have potential efficacy in treating COVID-19 . One is darunavir , which is a second-generation of HIV-1 protease inhibitor . {"text": "A joint research team of the Shanghai Institute of Materia Medica and Shanghai Tech University performed drug screening in silicon and an enzyme activity test , and they reported 30 agents with potential antiviral activity against SARS-CoV-2 on January 25 , 2020 ( 19 ) . {"text": "FIGURE 7 . Model of the PI kinases and PI4P involved in SARS-CoV S-mediated entry . After SARS-CoV binds to ACE2 , PI4P , the catalytic product of PI4 KB , creates a lipid microenvironment or PI4P-enriched organelle required for the steps leading to fusion . Pharmacological inhibitors of PI4 KB , such as LY294002 or wortmannin , suppress PI4 KB activity and thereby inhibit SARSCoV S-mediated entry . Cellular factors , such as PI3Ks or Sac1 , that negatively regulate PI4P generation can also inhibit SARS-CoV S-mediated entry .", "labels": [[275, 286, "PROTEIN"], [298, 306, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [491, 504, "ORGANISM"], [65, 76, "CL"], [451, 462, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [65, 84, "PROTEIN"], [275, 286, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [412, 422, "CHEBI"], [156, 166, "CHEBI"], [24, 27, "PROTEIN"], [412, 422, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [259, 275, "CHEBI"], [306, 318, "CHEBI"], [451, 462, "PROTEIN"], [192, 206, "GO"], [156, 166, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [306, 318, "CHEMICAL"], [298, 306, "CHEMICAL"], [65, 76, "CELL"], [412, 422, "PROTEIN"], [24, 27, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [172, 192, "CELL"], [306, 318, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [122, 136, "PROTEIN"], [56, 65, "ORGANISM"]]}

{"text": "Chloroquine was shown to inhibit quinone reductase 2 [ 56 ] , a structural neighbour of UDP-N-acetylglucosamine 2-epimerases [ 57 ] that are involved in the biosynthesis of sialic acids . The sialic acids are acidic monosaccharides found at the extremity of sugar chains present on cell transmembrane proteins and are critical components of ligand recognition . The possible interference of chloroquine with sialic acid biosynthesis could account for the broad antiviral spectrum of that drug since viruses such as the human coronavirus HCoV-O43 and the orthomyxoviruses use sialic acid moieties as receptors [ 58 ] .", "labels": [[209, 216, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [33, 53, "PROTEIN"], [271, 301, "PROTEIN"], [512, 537, "PROTEIN"], [554, 575, "CHEBI"], [375, 391, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [554, 575, "CHEMICAL"], [245, 264, "PROTEIN"], [157, 180, "CHEMICAL"], [271, 287, "CELLULAR_COMPONENT"], [33, 53, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [271, 301, "GO"], [157, 180, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [33, 53, "GGP"], [186, 199, "CHEMICAL"], [375, 391, "CHEMICAL"], [391, 408, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [245, 258, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [391, 408, "CHEMICAL"], [186, 199, "CHEBI"], [186, 199, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [157, 180, "CHEBI"], [391, 408, "CHEBI"], [85, 112, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [238, 245, "PATHOLOGICAL_FORMATION"], [554, 587, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [0, 12, "CHEBI"], [375, 391, "CHEBI"], [0, 12, "CHEMICAL"], [0, 12, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [512, 525, "ORGANISM"], [554, 587, "PROTEIN"], [199, 216, "CHEBI"], [519, 537, "CHEMICAL"], [33, 41, "CHEMICAL"], [546, 554, "TAXON"]]}

{"text": "The infection of SARS virus is initiated by the attachment of S protein to the receptor ACE2 [ 19 ] , followed by cleavage with host cell protease TMPRSS2 [ 20 - 22 ] . The viruses are then transported through the early and late endosomes , subsequently endo/lysosomes , during which host protein extracellular proteases including cathepsin L mediates the further cleavage of S protein in endocytic vesicles [ 23 - 26 ] . The activated S protein will then activate the fusion between viral and cell membranes and release the genome of SARS-CoV into cytoplasm .", "labels": [[4, 14, "DISEASE"], [64, 72, "CHEBI"], [271, 311, "PROTEIN"], [476, 494, "CELLULAR_COMPONENT"], [214, 229, "CELLULAR_COMPONENT"], [62, 72, "PROTEIN"], [321, 331, "GGP"], [535, 544, "GO"], [321, 331, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [138, 147, "GGP"], [17, 28, "ORGANISM"], [271, 297, "TAXON"], [88, 93, "GGP"], [364, 376, "PROTEIN"], [123, 147, "CELL"], [22, 28, "TAXON"], [284, 311, "CELLULAR_COMPONENT"], [378, 389, "CELLULAR_COMPONENT"], [476, 494, "GO"], [165, 173, "TAXON"], [321, 331, "PROTEIN"], [378, 389, "GO"], [123, 157, "PROTEIN"], [123, 133, "CL"], [17, 22, "DISEASE"], [364, 376, "CHEBI"], [88, 95, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"]]}

{"text": "A pH-dependant mechanism of entry of coronavirus into target cells was also reported for SARS-CoV-1 after binding of the DC-SIGN receptor [ 62 ] . The activation step that occurs in endosomes at acidic pH results in fusion of the viral and endosomal membranes leading to the release of the viral SARS-CoV-1 genome into the cytosol [63].In the absence of antiviral drug , the virus is targeted to the lysosomal compartment where the low pH , along with the action of enzymes , disrupts the viral particle , thus liberating the infectious nucleic acid and , in several cases , enzymes necessary for its replication [ 64 ] .", "labels": [[526, 537, "CHEBI"], [89, 100, "SO"], [37, 49, "TAXON"], [319, 331, "CELLULAR_COMPONENT"], [456, 466, "PROTEIN"], [61, 67, "CL"], [476, 489, "TAXON"], [54, 67, "CELL_TYPE"], [37, 49, "ORGANISM"], [61, 67, "CELL"], [121, 138, "PROTEIN"], [236, 250, "CELLULAR_COMPONENT"], [121, 129, "GGP"], [121, 138, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [286, 307, "DNA"], [236, 250, "GO"], [456, 466, "SO"], [567, 573, "SO"], [526, 537, "CHEMICAL"], [354, 364, "CHEBI"], [319, 331, "PROTEIN"]]}

{"text": "Translation attenuation has been widely observed as a defensive mechanism of the host cells against viral infection . {"text": "A previous attempt to predict drugs for the Mpro of SARS-CoV has identified two HIV-1 protease inhibitors , namely lopinavir and ritonavir , as potential candidates , both of which bind to the same target site of Mpro ( Nukoolkarn et al. , 2008 ) . The conserved amino acids Thr24-Asn28 and Asn119 ( numbered according to positions in SARS-CoV Mpro because the present sequence of 2019-nCoV Mpro in GenBank is in polypeptide form ) formed the binding pockets for lopinavir/ritonavir in the spatial structure of both SARS-CoV Mpro and 2019-nCoV Mpro , whereas the nearby non-conserved amino acids locate far away from the binding pocket , thus would not affect its structural conservation ( Fig. 1B ) .", "labels": [[52, 61, "GGP"], [508, 516, "GGP"], [361, 369, "SO"], [664, 675, "SO"], [275, 291, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [508, 516, "ORGANISM"], [391, 399, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [247, 291, "PROTEIN"], [253, 275, "CHEMICAL"], [322, 335, "ORGANISM"], [309, 322, "SO"], [559, 584, "PROTEIN"], [213, 220, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [198, 205, "SO"], [508, 534, "PROTEIN"], [52, 61, "ORGANISM"], [570, 584, "CHEBI"], [44, 61, "PROTEIN"], [247, 263, "SO"], [451, 463, "CHEMICAL"], [451, 463, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [570, 584, "AMINO_ACID"], [80, 106, "GGP"], [322, 335, "PROTEIN"], [570, 584, "CHEMICAL"], [80, 95, "ORGANISM"], [612, 621, "PROTEIN"]]}

{"text": "FIGURE 7 . Model of the PI kinases and PI4P involved in SARS-CoV S-mediated entry . After SARS-CoV binds to ACE2 , PI4P , the catalytic product of PI4 KB , creates a lipid microenvironment or PI4P-enriched organelle required for the steps leading to fusion . Pharmacological inhibitors of PI4 KB , such as LY294002 or wortmannin , suppress PI4 KB activity and thereby inhibit SARSCoV S-mediated entry . Cellular factors , such as PI3Ks or Sac1 , that negatively regulate PI4P generation can also inhibit SARS-CoV S-mediated entry .", "labels": [[275, 286, "PROTEIN"], [298, 306, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [491, 504, "ORGANISM"], [65, 76, "CL"], [56, 65, "ORGANISM"], [451, 462, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [65, 84, "PROTEIN"], [275, 286, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [412, 422, "CHEBI"], [156, 166, "CHEBI"], [24, 27, "PROTEIN"], [412, 422, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [259, 275, "CHEBI"], [306, 318, "CHEBI"], [451, 462, "PROTEIN"], [192, 206, "GO"], [156, 166, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [306, 318, "CHEMICAL"], [298, 306, "CHEMICAL"], [65, 76, "CELL"], [412, 422, "PROTEIN"], [24, 27, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [172, 192, "CELL"], [306, 318, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [122, 136, "PROTEIN"]]}

{"text": "FIGURE 7 . Model of the PI kinases and PI4P involved in SARS-CoV S-mediated entry . After SARS-CoV binds to ACE2 , PI4P , the catalytic product of PI4 KB , creates a lipid microenvironment or PI4P-enriched organelle required for the steps leading to fusion . Pharmacological inhibitors of PI4 KB , such as LY294002 or wortmannin , suppress PI4 KB activity and thereby inhibit SARSCoV S-mediated entry . Cellular factors , such as PI3Ks or Sac1 , that negatively regulate PI4P generation can also inhibit SARS-CoV S-mediated entry .", "labels": [[275, 286, "PROTEIN"], [298, 306, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [491, 504, "ORGANISM"], [65, 76, "CL"], [56, 65, "ORGANISM"], [451, 462, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [65, 84, "PROTEIN"], [275, 286, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [24, 27, "PROTEIN"], [412, 422, "CHEBI"], [156, 166, "CHEBI"], [412, 422, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [259, 275, "CHEBI"], [306, 318, "CHEBI"], [451, 462, "PROTEIN"], [24, 27, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [192, 206, "GO"], [156, 166, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [306, 318, "CHEMICAL"], [298, 306, "CHEMICAL"], [65, 76, "CELL"], [412, 422, "PROTEIN"], [172, 192, "CELL"], [306, 318, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [122, 136, "PROTEIN"]]}

{"text": "Chloroquine was shown to inhibit quinone reductase 2 [ 56 ] , a structural neighbour of UDP-N-acetylglucosamine 2-epimerases [ 57 ] that are involved in the biosynthesis of sialic acids . The sialic acids are acidic monosaccharides found at the extremity of sugar chains present on cell transmembrane proteins and are critical components of ligand recognition . The possible interference of chloroquine with sialic acid biosynthesis could account for the broad antiviral spectrum of that drug since viruses such as the human coronavirus HCoV-O43 and the orthomyxoviruses use sialic acid moieties as receptors [ 58 ] .", "labels": [[209, 216, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [33, 53, "PROTEIN"], [271, 301, "PROTEIN"], [512, 537, "PROTEIN"], [554, 587, "PROTEIN"], [375, 391, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [554, 575, "CHEMICAL"], [245, 264, "PROTEIN"], [157, 180, "CHEMICAL"], [271, 287, "CELLULAR_COMPONENT"], [33, 53, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [271, 301, "GO"], [157, 180, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [33, 53, "GGP"], [186, 199, "CHEMICAL"], [375, 391, "CHEMICAL"], [391, 408, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [245, 258, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [391, 408, "CHEMICAL"], [186, 199, "CHEBI"], [186, 199, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [157, 180, "CHEBI"], [391, 408, "CHEBI"], [85, 112, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [554, 587, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [238, 245, "PATHOLOGICAL_FORMATION"], [0, 12, "CHEBI"], [375, 391, "CHEBI"], [0, 12, "CHEMICAL"], [0, 12, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [554, 575, "CHEBI"], [512, 525, "ORGANISM"], [199, 216, "CHEBI"], [519, 537, "CHEMICAL"], [33, 41, "CHEMICAL"], [546, 554, "TAXON"]]}

{"text": "A pH-dependant mechanism of entry of coronavirus into target cells was also reported for SARS-CoV-1 after binding of the DC-SIGN receptor [ 62 ] . The activation step that occurs in endosomes at acidic pH results in fusion of the viral and endosomal membranes leading to the release of the viral SARS-CoV-1 genome into the cytosol [63].In the absence of antiviral drug , the virus is targeted to the lysosomal compartment where the low pH , along with the action of enzymes , disrupts the viral particle , thus liberating the infectious nucleic acid and , in several cases , enzymes necessary for its replication [ 64 ] .", "labels": [[526, 537, "CHEBI"], [89, 100, "SO"], [37, 49, "TAXON"], [319, 331, "CELLULAR_COMPONENT"], [456, 466, "PROTEIN"], [61, 67, "CL"], [476, 489, "TAXON"], [54, 67, "CELL_TYPE"], [37, 49, "ORGANISM"], [61, 67, "CELL"], [121, 138, "PROTEIN"], [236, 250, "CELLULAR_COMPONENT"], [121, 138, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [286, 307, "DNA"], [236, 250, "GO"], [121, 129, "GGP"], [456, 466, "SO"], [567, 573, "SO"], [526, 537, "CHEMICAL"], [354, 364, "CHEBI"], [319, 331, "PROTEIN"]]}
{"text": "The EDEMosomes are COPII-independent vesicles that export from the ER , which are normally used to fine-tune the level of ER degradation enhancer , mannosidase alpha-like 1 ( degradation enhancer, mannosidase alpha-like 1 ) , a regulator of ER-associated degradation ( ERAD;Cal\u00ec et al. , 2008 ) . It has been demonstrated that MHV infection causes accumulation of degradation enhancer, mannosidase alpha-like 1 and osteosarcoma amplified 9 ( OS-9 , another EDEMosome cargo),and that both degradation enhancer, mannosidase alpha-like 1 and OS-9 co-localize with the RTCs of MHV ( Reggiori et al. , 2010 ) .", "labels": [[228, 238, "ORGANISM"], [160, 171, "PROTEIN"], [122, 137, "DNA"], [67, 70, "PROTEIN"], [146, 171, "PROTEIN"], [148, 160, "PROTEIN"], [148, 160, "GGP"], [160, 171, "GGP"], [-1, 21, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [160, 171, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [281, 307, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [228, 247, "DISEASE"], [146, 171, "GGP"], [148, 160, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [-1, 21, "GO"], [4, 15, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [4, 15, "PROTEIN"], [146, 171, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [228, 238, "TAXON"], [181, 187, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [67, 70, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [37, 46, "CELLULAR_COMPONENT"], [125, 137, "DNA"], [360, 367, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [281, 290, "DISEASE"]]}

{"text": "However , if ER stress persists , GADD153 can induce apoptosis by suppressing the anti-apoptotic protein B-cell lymphoma 2 ( Bcl-2 ) and inducing the pro-apoptotic proteins such as Bcl-2-interacting mediator of cell death ( Bim;Puthalakath et al. , 2007 ) . GADD153 also activates ER oxidoreductin-1\u03b1 ( ERO1\u03b1 ) , which encodes an ER oxidase . {"text": "Chloroquine was shown to inhibit quinone reductase 2 [ 56 ] , a structural neighbour of UDP-N-acetylglucosamine 2-epimerases [ 57 ] that are involved in the biosynthesis of sialic acids . The sialic acids are acidic monosaccharides found at the extremity of sugar chains present on cell transmembrane proteins and are critical components of ligand recognition . The possible interference of chloroquine with sialic acid biosynthesis could account for the broad antiviral spectrum of that drug since viruses such as the human coronavirus HCoV-O43 and the orthomyxoviruses use sialic acid moieties as receptors [ 58 ] .", "labels": [[209, 216, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [271, 301, "PROTEIN"], [512, 537, "PROTEIN"], [33, 53, "GGP"], [554, 575, "CHEBI"], [375, 391, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [554, 575, "CHEMICAL"], [245, 264, "PROTEIN"], [33, 53, "PROTEIN"], [157, 180, "CHEMICAL"], [271, 287, "CELLULAR_COMPONENT"], [271, 301, "GO"], [157, 180, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [186, 199, "CHEMICAL"], [375, 391, "CHEMICAL"], [391, 408, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [33, 53, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [245, 258, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [391, 408, "CHEMICAL"], [186, 199, "CHEBI"], [186, 199, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [157, 180, "CHEBI"], [391, 408, "CHEBI"], [85, 112, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [238, 245, "PATHOLOGICAL_FORMATION"], [554, 587, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [0, 12, "CHEBI"], [375, 391, "CHEBI"], [0, 12, "CHEMICAL"], [0, 12, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [512, 525, "ORGANISM"], [554, 587, "PROTEIN"], [199, 216, "CHEBI"], [519, 537, "CHEMICAL"], [33, 41, "CHEMICAL"], [546, 554, "TAXON"]]}

{"text": "A pH-dependant mechanism of entry of coronavirus into target cells was also reported for SARS-CoV-1 after binding of the DC-SIGN receptor [ 62 ] . The activation step that occurs in endosomes at acidic pH results in fusion of the viral and endosomal membranes leading to the release of the viral SARS-CoV-1 genome into the cytosol [63].In the absence of antiviral drug , the virus is targeted to the lysosomal compartment where the low pH , along with the action of enzymes , disrupts the viral particle , thus liberating the infectious nucleic acid and , in several cases , enzymes necessary for its replication [ 64 ] .", "labels": [[526, 537, "CHEBI"], [89, 100, "SO"], [37, 49, "TAXON"], [319, 331, "CELLULAR_COMPONENT"], [456, 466, "PROTEIN"], [61, 67, "CL"], [476, 489, "TAXON"], [54, 67, "CELL_TYPE"], [37, 49, "ORGANISM"], [61, 67, "CELL"], [121, 138, "PROTEIN"], [236, 250, "CELLULAR_COMPONENT"], [121, 129, "GGP"], [121, 138, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [286, 307, "DNA"], [236, 250, "GO"], [456, 466, "SO"], [567, 573, "SO"], [526, 537, "CHEMICAL"], [354, 364, "CHEBI"], [319, 331, "PROTEIN"]]}

{"text": "FIGURE 7 . Model of the PI kinases and PI4P involved in SARS-CoV S-mediated entry . After SARS-CoV binds to ACE2 , PI4P , the catalytic product of PI4 KB , creates a lipid microenvironment or PI4P-enriched organelle required for the steps leading to fusion . Pharmacological inhibitors of PI4 KB , such as LY294002 or wortmannin , suppress PI4 KB activity and thereby inhibit SARSCoV S-mediated entry . Cellular factors , such as PI3Ks or Sac1 , that negatively regulate PI4P generation can also inhibit SARS-CoV S-mediated entry .", "labels": [[275, 286, "PROTEIN"], [298, 306, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [491, 504, "ORGANISM"], [65, 76, "CL"], [56, 65, "ORGANISM"], [451, 462, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [65, 84, "PROTEIN"], [275, 286, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [24, 27, "PROTEIN"], [412, 422, "CHEBI"], [156, 166, "CHEBI"], [412, 422, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [259, 275, "CHEBI"], [306, 318, "CHEBI"], [451, 462, "PROTEIN"], [24, 27, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [192, 206, "GO"], [156, 166, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [306, 318, "CHEMICAL"], [298, 306, "CHEMICAL"], [65, 76, "CELL"], [412, 422, "PROTEIN"], [172, 192, "CELL"], [306, 318, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [122, 136, "PROTEIN"]]}

{"text": "A joint research team of the Shanghai Institute of Materia Medica and Shanghai Tech University performed drug screening in silicon and an enzyme activity test , and they reported 30 agents with potential antiviral activity against SARS-CoV-2 on January 25 , 2020 ( 19 ) . These agents are indinavir , saquinavir , lopinavir , carfilzomib , ritonavir , remdesivir , atazanavir , darunavir , tipranavir , fosamprenavir , enzaplatovir , presatovir , abacavir , bortezomib , elvitegravir , maribavir , raltegravir , montelukast , deoxyrhapontin , polydatin , chalcone , disulfiram , carmofur , shikonin , ebselen , tideglusib , PX-12 , TDZD-8 , cyclosporin A , and cinanserin . {"text": "A joint research team of the Shanghai Institute of Materia Medica and Shanghai Tech University performed drug screening in silicon and an enzyme activity test , and they reported 30 agents with potential antiviral activity against SARS-CoV-2 on January 25 , 2020 ( 19 ) . These agents are indinavir , saquinavir , lopinavir , carfilzomib , ritonavir , remdesivir , atazanavir , darunavir , tipranavir , fosamprenavir , enzaplatovir , presatovir , abacavir , bortezomib , elvitegravir , maribavir , raltegravir , montelukast , deoxyrhapontin , polydatin , chalcone , disulfiram , carmofur , shikonin , ebselen , tideglusib , PX-12 , TDZD-8 , cyclosporin A , and cinanserin . {"text": "A joint research team of the Shanghai Institute of Materia Medica and Shanghai Tech University performed drug screening in silicon and an enzyme activity test , and they reported 30 agents with potential antiviral activity against SARS-CoV-2 on January 25 , 2020 ( 19 ) . These agents are indinavir , saquinavir , lopinavir , carfilzomib , ritonavir , remdesivir , atazanavir , darunavir , tipranavir , fosamprenavir , enzaplatovir , presatovir , abacavir , bortezomib , elvitegravir , maribavir , raltegravir , montelukast , deoxyrhapontin , polydatin , chalcone , disulfiram , carmofur , shikonin , ebselen , tideglusib , PX-12 , TDZD-8 , cyclosporin A , and cinanserin . {"text": "SGs are induced by protein kinase R (PKR)-mediated phosphorylation of eIF2\u03b1 upon viral dsRNA recognition [ 57 ] . Promoting G3BP aggregation via the eIF4A inhibitor Zotatafin [ 58,59 ] or reducing SG disassembly by Silmitasertib inhibition of CK2 [ 60 ] warrant investigation for treatment of SARS-CoV-2 . The mTOR inhibitor rapamycin disrupts the binding of LARP1 to mTORC1 [ 61 ] and has been shown to reduce MERS infection by \u223c60 % in vitro [ 62 ] , another drug that could be tested for repurposing .", "labels": [[19, 36, "PROTEIN"], [348, 356, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [401, 416, "DISEASE"], [70, 76, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [114, 124, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [348, 356, "PROTEIN"], [229, 243, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [0, 4, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [70, 76, "PROTEIN"], [280, 293, "CHEMICAL"], [19, 27, "CHEBI"], [293, 325, "GGP"], [114, 124, "PROTEIN"], [145, 155, "CHEBI"], [0, 4, "PROTEIN"], [348, 356, "GGP"], [0, 4, "GO"], [229, 240, "PROTEIN"], [114, 124, "GGP"], [145, 165, "PROTEIN"], [200, 215, "ORGANISM"], [293, 306, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [200, 215, "CHEMICAL"], [19, 36, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [155, 165, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [359, 368, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [359, 365, "PROTEIN"], [280, 293, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [81, 93, "TAXON"], [155, 165, "CHEMICAL"]]}

{"text": "In the nasal HAE , the response after 24 hpi ( peak at 72 - 96 hpi ) is driven by a strong upregulation of type I and type III IFNs ( IFNB1 , IFNL1 , IFNL2 - 3 - 4 ) as well as other immunity-related genes . Whereas only a subset of these genes ( CXCL10/IP10 , CXCL2/MIP2A , IL1A , IL1B , Mx1 and ZBP1 ) follow the same pattern in the bronchial HAE , though at overall lower expression levels , the initial modulation of IFNB1 , IFNL1 , CCL2/MCP1 and IL6 in this tissue seems to fade at 96 hpi .", "labels": [[275, 282, "GGP"], [275, 282, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [91, 127, "PROTEIN"], [315, 328, "DISEASE"], [407, 421, "PROTEIN"], [142, 150, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [91, 107, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [134, 140, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [127, 134, "PROTEIN"], [114, 127, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [134, 140, "GGP"], [407, 421, "GGP"], [134, 140, "DNA"], [261, 273, "GGP"], [127, 134, "GGP"], [223, 230, "SO"], [261, 273, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [142, 148, "GGP"], [407, 421, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [169, 183, "DNA"], [275, 282, "PROTEIN"], [127, 134, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [261, 273, "PROTEIN"]]}

{"text": "The infection of SARS virus is initiated by the attachment of S protein to the receptor ACE2 [ 19 ] , followed by cleavage with host cell protease TMPRSS2 [ 20 - 22 ] . The viruses are then transported through the early and late endosomes , subsequently endo/lysosomes , during which host protein extracellular proteases including cathepsin L mediates the further cleavage of S protein in endocytic vesicles [ 23 - 26 ] . The activated S protein will then activate the fusion between viral and cell membranes and release the genome of SARS-CoV into cytoplasm .", "labels": [[4, 14, "DISEASE"], [123, 133, "CL"], [64, 72, "CHEBI"], [271, 311, "PROTEIN"], [476, 494, "CELLULAR_COMPONENT"], [214, 229, "CELLULAR_COMPONENT"], [62, 72, "PROTEIN"], [321, 331, "GGP"], [535, 544, "GO"], [321, 331, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [138, 147, "GGP"], [17, 28, "ORGANISM"], [271, 297, "TAXON"], [88, 93, "GGP"], [364, 376, "PROTEIN"], [123, 147, "CELL"], [22, 28, "TAXON"], [284, 311, "CELLULAR_COMPONENT"], [378, 389, "CELLULAR_COMPONENT"], [476, 494, "GO"], [165, 173, "TAXON"], [321, 331, "PROTEIN"], [378, 389, "GO"], [123, 157, "PROTEIN"], [17, 22, "DISEASE"], [364, 376, "CHEBI"], [88, 95, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"]]}

{"text": "In the nasal HAE , the response after 24 hpi ( peak at 72 - 96 hpi ) is driven by a strong upregulation of type I and type III IFNs ( IFNB1 , IFNL1 , IFNL2 - 3 - 4 ) as well as other immunity-related genes . Whereas only a subset of these genes ( CXCL10/IP10 , CXCL2/MIP2A , IL1A , IL1B , Mx1 and ZBP1 ) follow the same pattern in the bronchial HAE , though at overall lower expression levels , the initial modulation of IFNB1 , IFNL1 , CCL2/MCP1 and IL6 in this tissue seems to fade at 96 hpi .", "labels": [[275, 282, "GGP"], [134, 140, "DNA"], [275, 282, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [91, 127, "PROTEIN"], [315, 328, "DISEASE"], [407, 421, "PROTEIN"], [142, 150, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [91, 107, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [134, 140, "GGP"], [127, 134, "PROTEIN"], [114, 127, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [407, 421, "GGP"], [261, 273, "GGP"], [127, 134, "GGP"], [223, 230, "SO"], [261, 273, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [142, 148, "GGP"], [407, 421, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [169, 183, "DNA"], [134, 140, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [275, 282, "PROTEIN"], [127, 134, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [261, 273, "PROTEIN"]]}

{"text": "In the nasal HAE , the response after 24 hpi ( peak at 72 - 96 hpi ) is driven by a strong upregulation of type I and type III IFNs ( IFNB1 , IFNL1 , IFNL2 - 3 - 4 ) as well as other immunity-related genes . Whereas only a subset of these genes ( CXCL10/IP10 , CXCL2/MIP2A , IL1A , IL1B , Mx1 and ZBP1 ) follow the same pattern in the bronchial HAE , though at overall lower expression levels , the initial modulation of IFNB1 , IFNL1 , CCL2/MCP1 and IL6 in this tissue seems to fade at 96 hpi .", "labels": [[275, 282, "GGP"], [275, 282, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [91, 127, "PROTEIN"], [315, 328, "DISEASE"], [407, 421, "PROTEIN"], [142, 150, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [91, 107, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [134, 140, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [127, 134, "PROTEIN"], [114, 127, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [134, 140, "GGP"], [407, 421, "GGP"], [134, 140, "DNA"], [261, 273, "GGP"], [127, 134, "GGP"], [223, 230, "SO"], [261, 273, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [142, 148, "GGP"], [407, 421, "SIMPLE_CHEMICAL"], [169, 183, "DNA"], [275, 282, "PROTEIN"], [127, 134, "GENE_OR_GENE_PRODUCT"], [261, 273, "PROTEIN"]]}
